detaileddescription.para: Set all parameters that matters for the calibration. The lower and upper bounds determines which parameters are subject to calibration. If lower and upper bound are equal, the parameter is untouched during calibration (regardless value)

prepare the optimization process by looking at the current state of the supplied parameters. Ensures :
the model have a global parameter-set

returns the initial state for the i'th cell

briefdescription.para: Call to optimize model, starting with p parameter set, using p_min..p_max as boundaries. where p is the full parameter vector. the p_min,p_max specified in constructor is used to reduce the parameterspace for the optimizer down to a minimum number to facilitate fast run.

parameterdescription.para: contains the starting point for the parameters
stop after n calls of the objective functions, i.e. simulations.
is the trust region start , default 0.1, ref bobyqa
is the trust region stop, default 1e-5, ref bobyqa

briefdescription.para: extracts vector of area_ts for all calculated catchments using the given property function tsf that should have signature pts_t (const cell& c)

simplesect.para: that this function sum together contributions at cell-level. TODO: Avoid duplicate code, - use average_catchment_feature(*model.cells, catchment_index, []() return c.rc.snow_sca) but it returns a shared_ptr..

briefdescription.para: returns the area weighted sum of vector<area_ts> according to t.catchment_indexes

from operator(), called by min_bobyqa, for each iteration, so p is bobyqa parameter vector notice that the function returns the value of the goal function, as specified by the target specification. The flexibility is rather large: It's a set of target-specifications, weighted, where each of them can be a KG or NS, for a specified period/resolution. E.g. we can specify targets that apply to specific catchments, and specified periods/resolutions.

The optimizer for parameters in a shyft::core::region_model provides needed functionality to orchestrate a search for the optimal parameters so that the goal function specified by the target_specifications are minmized. The user can specify which parameters (model specific) to optimize, giving range min..max for each of the parameters. Only parameters with min != max are used, thus minimizing the parameter space.

detaileddescription.para: Target specification target_specification allows a lot of flexiblity when it comes to what goes into the shyft::timeseries::nash_sutcliffe_goal_function or kling-gupta function.

The search for optimium starts with the current parameter-set, the current start state, over the specified model time-axis. After a run, the goal function is calculated and returned back to the minbobyqa algorithm that continue searching for the minimum value until tolerances/iterations area reached.

parameterdescription.para:
the region model, and we use that supports the following member:
.time_axis, a time-axis value and type used by the model, the optimizer needs this during goal function evaluation.
.run(), the region model from state (s0) over .time_axis, using current values of parameters.
a template parameter for the parameters, supporting vector form access
type of the target time-series, inside. the target specification..(SiH: can we turn it the other way around ??)
